data.title: Our NYC Facial Plastic Surgery Office
data.meta_description: The offices of NYC facial plastic surgery specialist Dr. Konstantin Vasyukevich are located in Manhattan's Upper East Side, a few blocks from Central Park.
data.text:
Parking Information

Multiple parking options are available, both across the street from the practice and within a couple of blocks. You can see the different parking locations and rates through Best Parking.

Dr. Konstantin’s Manhattan office, only a few blocks from Central Park and The Metropolitan Museum of Art, complements the refinement and sophistication you’ll find with one of New York City’s busiest facial plastic surgery specialists. Dr. Konstantin’s reputation for for natural-looking results attracts women and men from throughout the region as well as many out-of-town and international patients. Facial plastic surgery patients travel to Manhattan’s Upper East Side from Brooklyn and other Long Island communities to have Dr. Konstantin enhance their appearances, whether they are considering a facelift, blepharoplasty or nonsurgical facial rejuvenation such as cosmetic injectable treatments (e.g., BOTOX® or dermal fillers).

To meet with Dr. Konstantin personally about facial rejuvenation, request a consultation[/link] using the online form, or call our office at (212) 380-3634.

“I love my new face and recommend Dr. Konstantin to all my friends. The beautiful thing about his work is that nobody really knows that I had a facelift. That is how amazing his work is.” — RealSelf user from Manhattan

Driving Directions

From Brooklyn or Staten Island

Use either the Brooklyn Bridge, Manhattan Bridge, or Williamsburg Bridge to cross the East River into Manhattan.

Take FDR Drive north to the 61st Street exit.

Continue west on 61st Street to 3rd Avenue.

Turn right on 3rd Avenue and continue to East 79th Street.

Turn left on East 79th Street towards Central Park.

Our office is on the right side of the street between Park and Madison avenues. Our building is between the Greek Consulate and The New York Society Library.

From Southern New Jersey

Use either the Lincoln Tunnel or Holland Tunnel to cross the Hudson River into Manhattan.

Take Henry Hudson Parkway (State Route 9A) north to the 79th Street exit.

Take 79th Street through Central Park and cross 5th Avenue.

Our office is on the left between Madison and Park avenues. Our building is between The New York Society Library and the Greek Consulate.

From Northern New Jersey, the Bronx, or New England/Connecticut

Use the George Washington Bridge to cross the Harlem River into Manhattan.

Travel south on Harlem River Drive/FDR Drive.

Continue on FDR Drive south to the 96th Street exit.

Take York Avenue south to East 79th Street.

Turn right on East 79th Street.

ALTERNATE ROUTE

Use the George Washington Bridge to cross the Hudson River into Manhattan.

Travel south on Henry Hudson Parkway to 79th Street/Boat Basin exit.

Take 79th Street across Central Park, 5th Avenue, and Madison Avenue.

Our office is on the left, between Madison and Park Avenues.

Our building is between The New York Society Library and the Greek Consulate.

From the Bronx or Westchester/Upstate New York

Take the Major Deegan Expressway (Interstate 87) south to the Robert F. Kennedy Bridge (toll road).

Use the Robert F. Kennedy Bridge (formerly Triborough Bridge) to cross the Harlem River into Manhattan.

Travel south on FDR Drive to the 96th Street exit.

Take York Avenue south to East 79th Street.

Turn right on East 79th Street.

Our office is on the right, between Madison and Park Avenues.

Our building is between The New York Society Library and the Greek Consulate.

From Queens or Long Island

Use the Robert F. Kennedy Bridge (formerly Triborough Bridge) to cross the Harlem River into Manhattan.

Travel south on FDR Drive to the 96th Street exit.

Take York Avenue south to East 79th Street.

Turn right on East 79th Street, toward Central Park.

Our office is on the right, between Madison and Park Avenues.

Our building is between The New York Society Library and the Greek Consulate.

ALTERNATE ROUTE

Use the Queens Midtown Tunnel to cross the East River into Manhattan to 3rd Avenue.

Turn right on 3rd Avenue and travel north to East 79th Street.

Turn left on East 79th Street.

Our office is on the right, between Madison and Park Avenues.

Our building is between The New York Society Library and the Greek Consulate.

Hotels near Dr. Konstantin’s office

New York City has lots of hotels and the prices per night vary from $150/night – $500/ night and above. The following hotels and furnished apartments are either within walking distance from Dr. Konstantin’s office or require a short taxi ride. We also recommend websites such as airbnb.com, www.booking.com and www.hotels.com for making living arrangements in NYC.
